actions.action:
cat << 'ENDOFFILE' > train_and_predict.py
import pandas as pd
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.preprocessing import PolynomialFeatures, StandardScaler
from sklearn.linear_model import LinearRegression
from sklearn.metrics import mean_squared_error

# Load data
train = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Combine train and test sets for preprocessing
combined = pd.concat([train, test], ignore_index=True)

# Drop unnecessary columns
columns_to_drop = ['Id', 'SalePrice']
y = combined['SalePrice'].dropna()
X = combined.drop(columns=columns_to_drop)

# Handle missing values
X.fillna(method='ffill', inplace=True)

# Encode categorical variables
X = pd.get_dummies(X)

# Create polynomial features
poly = PolynomialFeatures(degree=2, interaction_only=True, include_bias=False)
X_poly = poly.fit_transform(X)

# Split back into train and test sets
X_train = X_poly[:len(train)]
X_test = X_poly[len(train):]

# Scale numerical features
scaler = StandardScaler()
X_train_scaled = scaler.fit_transform(X_train)
X_test_scaled = scaler.transform(X_test)

# Train a linear regression model
model = LinearRegression()
model.fit(X_train_scaled, y)

# Make predictions
predictions = model.predict(X_test_scaled)

# Save predictions to submission.csv
submission = pd.DataFrame({'Id': test['Id'], 'SalePrice': predictions})
submission.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)
ENDOFFILE

import pandas as pd
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.preprocessing import PolynomialFeatures, StandardScaler
from sklearn.linear_model import LinearRegression
from sklearn.metrics import mean_squared_error

# Load data
train = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Combine train and test sets for preprocessing
combined = pd.concat([train, test], ignore_index=True)

# Drop unnecessary columns
columns_to_drop = ['Id', 'SalePrice']
y = combined['SalePrice'].dropna()
X = combined.drop(columns=columns_to_drop)

# Handle missing values
X.fillna(method='ffill', inplace=True)

# Encode categorical variables
X = pd.get_dummies(X)

# Create polynomial features
poly = PolynomialFeatures(degree=2, interaction_only=True, include_bias=False)
X_poly = poly.fit_transform(X)

# Split back into train and test sets
X_train = X_poly[:len(train)]
X_test = X_poly[len(train):]

# Scale numerical features
scaler = StandardScaler()
X_train_scaled = scaler.fit_transform(X_train)
X_test_scaled = scaler.transform(X_test)

# Train a linear regression model
model = LinearRegression()
model.fit(X_train_scaled, y)

# Make predictions
predictions = model.predict(X_test_scaled)

# Save predictions to submission.csv
submission = pd.DataFrame({'Id': test['Id'], 'SalePrice': predictions})
submission.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)
ENDOFFILE
